value.title: Tesla debuts new car insurance that uses Texans' real-time driving behavior
value.excerpt: Tesla now offers insurance in Texas, and it calculates for premiums based on owners' real-time driving behavior..

value.title: Tesla is under pressure from NHTSA over Full Self-Driving Beta NDA and ‘stealth recall’
value.excerpt: The NHTSA is upping the pressure on Tesla as the regulator asked for more information about the non-disclosure agreement it made Full Self-Driving Beta testers agree to. The government is also questioning Tesla about what it believes to be a potential “stealth recall” of Autopilot.

value.title: Tesla Begins Roll-Out of its Full Self Driving Beta 10.2 Software, 1,000 Cars Included
value.excerpt: Elon Musk on Monday said Tesla has finally started rolling out its Full Self-Driving (FSD) Beta 10.2 software. The software was slated for a roll out to about 1,000 Tesla owners last weekend but was delayed owing to “last-minute concerns".

value.title: Hyundai Mobis develops a foldable steering wheel system for self-driving car
value.excerpt: A foldable steering wheel system for self-driving cars has been developed by Hyundai Mobis. Hyundai Mobis announced on Monday that it has developed the 'foldable steering system' that can store the steering wheel of the driver's seat invisible by folding it.

value.title: General Motors' Cruise To Launch 1 Mln Self-driving Cars By 2030
value.excerpt: General Motors Co.'s (GM) autonomous vehicle subsidiary Cruise is planning to launch at least 1 million self-driving cars by the year 2030. General Motors is the majority stake-holder in the autonomous company.

value.title: GM-backed Cruise targets 1 million self-driving vehicles by 2030
value.excerpt: Cruise, General Motors' majority-owned autonomous vehicle subsidiary, is targeting a fleet of 1 million or more self-driving vehicles by 2030.

value.title: GM Ultra Cruise pushes closer to door-to-door self-driving cars
value.excerpt: General Motors is officially dialing its self-driving program up from "Super" to "Ultra." Set to launch in model year 2023, the all-new Ultra Cruise system promises a full hands-free driving experience in 95 percent of driving scenarios.
